abstract: Clouds persisted Wednesday over European credit markets, with some commercial banks still reluctant to lend to each other.
snippet: Clouds persisted Wednesday over European credit markets, with some commercial banks still reluctant to lend to each other.
lead_paragraph: LONDON, Aug. 22 —Clouds persisted Wednesday over European credit markets, with some commercial banks still reluctant to lend to each other.

headline.main: European Banks Still Wary on Lending

byline.original: By Julia Werdigier and Carter Dougherty

abstract: More banks have stepped forward and said they have availed themselves of the Federal Reserve’s discount-lending rate cut amid the credit market’s turmoil last week. The four biggest banks in the United States — Citigroup, J.P. Morgan Chase, Bank of America and Wachovia — said that they each borrowed $500 million through the so-called discount window by taking out loans directly from the Fed.
lead_paragraph: More banks have stepped forward and said they have availed themselves of the Federal Reserve’s discount-lending rate cut amid the credit market’s turmoil last week. The four biggest banks in the United States — Citigroup, J.P. Morgan Chase, Bank of America and Wachovia — said that they each borrowed $500 million through the so-called discount window by taking out loans directly from the Fed.

headline.main: Top U.S. Banks Draw Upon Fed Discount Window
